p: When compared to all other patients admitted to our hospital during the same period of time, patients with community-acquired RSV infections accounted for 1.6% of inpatients and 3.1% of the total number of hospitalization days. The burden of community-acquired RSV infections was disproportionately higher in pediatric than in adult patients: 2.1% versus 0.2% of the total number of pediatric and adult inpatients, respectively (p < 0.0001); 4.2% versus 0.2% of the total number of hospitalization days in pediatric and adult units, respectively (p < 0.0001).
